solution_line_template: He sold an average of {average_books_per_month} books per month across all {num_months} months so he must have sold a total of {num_months}*{average_books_per_month} = <<{average_books_per_month}*{num_months}={total_books_3_months}>>{total_books_3_months} books in those {num_months} months
He sold {january_sales}+{february_sales} = <<{january_sales}+{february_sales}={jan_feb_sales}>>{jan_feb_sales} in January and February
He must have sold {total_books_3_months}-{jan_feb_sales} = <<{total_books_3_months}-{jan_feb_sales}={march_sales}>>{march_sales} books in March
